steps.title: Make cuttings of about 10 centimeter (3.9 in) in length.
steps.content: Make cuttings of about 10 centimeter (3.9 in) in length. Choose firm, semi-ripe shoots. This can be done during summer or early autumn. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Dip the cuttings into root growth hormone.
steps.content: Dip the cuttings into root growth hormone. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Fill a container with pumice or coarse sand.
steps.content: Fill a container with pumice or coarse sand. Place the cuttings into this container.

steps.title: Water gently and sparingly.
steps.content: Water gently and sparingly. It is important not to overwater the cuttings. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Keep the cuttings away from direct sunlight.
steps.content: Keep the cuttings away from direct sunlight. Keep inside a sheltered plastic container if it's cold.

steps.title: Use a spray mister to finely mist the cuttings regularly.
steps.content: Use a spray mister to finely mist the cuttings regularly.

steps.title: Be patient.
steps.content: Be patient. It'll be at least six months before you see any signs of roots; even then, it may not have been successful.
